result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick W Burneske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge, plus a $5,000.00 mandatory surcharge for possession of child pornography. To be paid by 11/16/2023.  DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; but concurrent with count two. Credit for five (5) days.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 17.  Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this Order is violated.

Sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Register with the Sex Offender Registry.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; but concurrent with count one. Credit for five (5) days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick W Burneske

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (49 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 11-16-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2, credit for 5 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 1, credit for 5 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges plus a $5000.00 mandatory surcharge for possession of child pornography, are to be paid by 11/16/2023, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 11/16/2023, DOC is to collect up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 17. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Sex Offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
*Defendant to Register with the Sex Offender Registry
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing, however, defense requested an adjournment due to the defendant's ongoing medical condition. State and Court expressed concerns about the length of the case. Court ordered stayed warrant lifted and granted the Defense's motion to adjourn sentencing. ADA Williams informed the court that she may be in trial in branch 2 on the next date. Case adjourned in branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
From Defense; to adjourn sentencing. Received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is currently at Froedhert hospital.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 10/30/2015. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. Defendant sworn as to statements. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instruction received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms (body armor); also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements; he was also advised that they cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires them to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age. Defendant also advised he may be subject to possible future proceedings as a Sexually Violent Person under Wisconsin Statutes Chapter 980.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, AND 10
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered counts 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10 Dismissed, But Read In.

Case adjourned to branch 15 for Sentencing.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Court amended information with stipulation of parties to include the word 'Possess' in between knowingly and motion in the first sentence of the Information.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state informs the court that the DOJ Agent on this case is not available for the trial date of 8-10-2015 and is requesting an adjournmen of the trial.  The defense has no objection.  Negotiations are on-going.  The court will convert the trial date to a final pretrial.
A new jury trial date is set.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 of the Safety Building.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 6/22/15 received and filed.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for Jennifer Williams for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense is asking for a couple of weeks to review discovery and determine how to proceed.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
At request of the court case is moved to June 3 at 8:15 for arraignment.  All parties notified of change.  Defendant is to be present.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jesica Ballenger for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Ron Dague for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Oral No Contact Order with ANY CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 18 AND NO ELECTRONIC DEVICES OR COMPUTERS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Patrick W Burneske in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Patrick W Burneske in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
